physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features three men. They are all sitting down around a table. Two of them are drinking from a teacup, while the third is reading a document. Both of the men are looking at him as he reads. There is a potted plant on the ground to the left hand side of the photograph. The background shows plants around the walls.
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows three men in an informal setting 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
subject_terms_1: group portraits men (male humans) studio portraits
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Portraits, Group Men
